claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.
explanation: A forest plot titled 'Subgroup Analysis of Relative Vaccine Effectiveness (95% CI)' showing the relative effectiveness (percentages with 95% confidence intervals) of a recombinant influenza vaccine compared to a standard-dose vaccine across various subgroups: PCR-confirmed influenza, hospitalization for PCR-confirmed influenza, and hospitalization for community-acquired pneumonia. Each outcome is stratified by participants’ preexisting conditions (cardiovascular disease, respiratory disease, cardiorespiratory disease, obesity, diabetes, and any of the above conditions). does not support the claim because the figure only presents subgroup relative effectiveness data and contains no information on antigenic match or alignment with WHO- or FDA-selected influenza strains, so it does not support the claim.

Each outcome is stratified by participants’ preexisting conditions (cardiovascular disease, respiratory disease, cardiorespiratory disease, obesity, diabetes, and any of the above conditions).
